intro: Afrardisia leucantha, commonly known as the white-flowered African bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, white to pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and slightly hairy, while its stems are upright and branching. Afrardisia leucantha is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens for its delicate, elegant blooms.
